channel.title: Events on Open Source Cities - Montréal
channel.description: Recent content in Events on Open Source Cities - Montréal

item.description: Let’s kickoff the new season of meetups by diving into #Hacktoberfest! If you haven’t already heard about it, head over to https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com/ and register to track your progress throughout the month. Schedule: - 5:00pm Open doors, arrive early to meet the group - 6:00pm Start presentation of the day - 6:30pm Lightning talks This month we’ll have Kim Noel talking about Open Source! We’ll go through a kick run down of the history behind Hacktoberfest, an intro to open source and a short demo about contributing – what a documentation contribution looks like, what a code sample contribution looks like, and maybe even checkout some core code contributions!

Let’s get together along with the group of people already united around https://github.com/opensourcecities/montreal to share some ideas and start interesting open source related discussions :) This month we’ll have Vincent Cloutier sharing his experience working on ipfs.pics: ipfs.pics is getting reborn! ipfs.pics is an open-source photo sharing system with undeletable pictures (think of it as the anti-snapchat), that became quite large before overwhelming its creators with stars (900 stars on github), memes (russian), and porn (obviously).

Let’s get together along with the group of people already united around https://github.com/opensourcecities/montreal to share some ideas and start interesting open source related discussions :) We’ll have 2 presentations to be announced soon (will update this description as soon as it’s confirmed) but the most important thing is to get there and finally meet this amazing group of people and help decide what direction do we want to take with this meetup.
